30 30

Celebrating 30 Years of AIDS Vancouver

The 30 30 campaign was created in 2013 to celebrate AIDS Vancouver’s 30th anniversary. The campaign pieces together the dynamic history of HIV in Vancouver, told by and for those who where there.

1992

1993

A tristique penatibus urna ridiculus placerat dapibus.

In 1993

  • Prime Minister Brian Mulroney resigns amidst political and economic turmoil. Kim Campbell, becomes Canada's first female Prime Minister. LINK
  • World Trade Center bombing: In New York. LINK
  • Tennis star Monica Seles is stabbed in the back by an obsessed fan of rival Steffi Graf. LINK

Local

  • Friends for life started in a one bedroom apartment giving massages and hot food to people living with HIV/AIDS. LINK
  • McLaren House closes and those housing units are replaced by Portable Rent Supplements. LINK

Statistics

  • 9,563 calls to AIDS Vanocuver's Helpline.
  • 360,909 cases of AIDS reported to date in US. LINK
  • 3.3 million worldwide AIDS deaths. LINK

Global

  • The first AIDS Life Ball takes place in Vienna, Austria. LINK
  • The CDC NIH and FDA declares the “highly effective” for prevention of HIV infection, and approves the female condom. LINK
  • AZT -no proof of benefit to early stage HIV. LINK
  • FDA approves female condom for sale in the US. LINK

National

  • Krever Inquiry begins. LINK
  • Jean Chrétien elected prime minister. LINK
1994

Print Sponsor
AIDS Vancouver - Prevent. Act. Support.

AIDS Vancouver plays a special role in providing quality health care to people affected by HIV/AIDS living in the Lower Mainland. It is clearly more than just a community health care organization. It is an organization whose presence and continued strength is essential to the quality for life of this community and of each individual and family who draws on its services. Our Agency is a vital community asset which everyone affected by HIV/AIDS can share, and in which we all have a stake.

Visit us at aidsvancouver.org

2013 © AIDS Vancouver
